title: 2010–11 Cupa României
text:
The 2010–11 <a href="Cupa%20Rom%C3%A2niei">Cupa României</a> was the seventy-third season of the annual <a href="Romania">Romania</a>n <a href="Association%20football">football</a> knockout tournament. It began on 17 July 2010 with the matches of the first round. For the third consecutive season, <a href="CFR%20Cluj">CFR Cluj</a> were the defending champions. However, CFR were eliminated in the quarter-finals by <a href="Gloria%20Bistri%C5%A3a">Gloria Bistriţa</a>, and the cup was won by <a href="Fotbal%20Club%20FCSB">FCSB</a> for the first time after 12 years.
The winners of the competition qualified for the <a href="2011%E2%80%9312%20UEFA%20Europa%20League%23Play-off%20round">play-off round</a> of the <a href="2011%E2%80%9312%20UEFA%20Europa%20League">2011–12 UEFA Europa League</a>.
Round of 32.
The 14 winners of the fifth phase entered in this round and were joined by the 18 teams from <a href="2010%E2%80%9311%20Liga%20I">2010–11 Liga I</a>.
A more complex seeding process was employed for this round. The 32 teams were divided in three pots: A, B and C. Pot A contained the first 6 teams from the previous <a href="2009%E2%80%9310%20Liga%20I">season</a> of Liga I. Pot B contained the remaining 12 teams from Liga I, and pot C was filled with the 14 clubs from lower leagues. 6 teams from pot C were paired with teams from pot A, with the remaining 8 being drawn against clubs from pot B. Lastly, the four remaining teams from pot B were mated between them.
Round of 16.
»>
